Comments_List: I learned the grammars, sandhi and declinations of elementary Sanskrit. I also learned some interesting things about India and other countries.

I learned the Devanagari scripts of Sanskrit, their Roman transliterations and their pronunciation. The main skill is reading Sanskrit passages, including a range of words, their declensions, several tenses, modes and tones.

Strengths: The handouts and syllabus were very helpful. We elaborated the grammars together. So it is a great convenience for us to learn in class.

Weaknesses: We need more chalks?

The course schedule is well organized. Quizzes in every week could push us to grasp what we have learned. The class is small so that everyone has the opportunity to speak and receive the feedback from the lecturer.
If time permits, it also helps to review a whole passage after we have decoded each sentence, so that we could apprehend the general idea more clearly.

It depends on the major of the student. If he/she is interested in Indian culture, literature, and religions, I will recommend this course to him/her. Although many students think it's too hard to study Sanskrit, in class I think it is hard but interesting. And it was useful when I listened to some lectures on comparative studies between different translations of Sanskrit sutras.
Sanskrit is a beautiful language, a good start to learn ancient Indian philosophy.
